content.description: Sit start as far left as you can go on left broken left face on a good shelf, from here move right using good feet, and alright hands until you reach the giant good sidepull. This can be done with small face crimps or a long move. Then keep traversing around the blunt arete and finish with pop top, the crux is the last move, in which you need to get high feet and rock over, it is a mantle-ish move.
content.protection: Pad, spotter, and watch out for the tree.
content.location: On the Ships Prow Boulder, on the left broken face. Downclimb the easy area by the start.

content.description: The sharp arete on the Ship's Prow Boulder, is a great route but has potential for an awkward fall into the tree that is just to the left of it. You can climb this from a sit start or a stand start, on good holds. Most of the feet are there but it is a little weird because you are hugging the arete all the way to the top. I recommend this to everyone, it is a lot of fun, with a few weird moves but to keep some adventure in this route I am not going to describe these weird moves, just jump on the route and you will finish with a smile.
content.location: On sharp arete on Ship's Prow this arete points to Prow Wow aka the Monkey Hang.

content.description:
Climb the central face starting on the slopey shelf. If you can reach the back of the shelf there is a small incut for your fingers. When starting put your feet on slippery feet and move up and right to a good hold, from here is the crux, mantle onto the slopey ledge and move left hand to a decent hold near the top, stand up completely and pull over the top, the top out couldn't be any better. 

  I found a sit start for this problem using one left foot and two small crimps way low making a big move to the shelf. The sit start is really low and left of shelf. I believe this move alone makes it V2.
content.location: On the Ships Prow Boulder just right of Bang Boom.

content.description: Short but fun route on the Ship's Prow Boulder. Stand start on the small shelves with a high foot, and pop to a bump on top of face, this bump is slopey but if caught just right it is fairly good. The crux comes after this and is actually a foot movement, move your right foot to a shelf, which is bomber but it is really high. Once your feet are on this ledge you can stand on it but the hard part is not over, you must still pull over the top, and besides the bump your right hand is on, the top is fairly blank, there are small indents on the top that must be used also a heel hook with the left foot is a good idea.
content.location: On the Ship's Prow boulder, all the way left on the face that faces the road.

content.description:
This route is defined by balance, short but intense, the holds are small. The top out can feel sketchy. Do it from a stand start. There is no real crux and no powerful moves, so remember your balance and move slowly. Start with your hand about head height with a hand out right and your left right in front of your body pull onto the rock and move your right hand up about two feet. Then stretch out left to a small hard to find hold, once in this position get situated and slowly move right hand above your head to a pretty good hold, match then top out. 

  There is an alternate sit start here as well maybe half a grade harder. This is on the small sharp flake that is fairly low, the start is cramped and hard, with awkward feet.
content.location: This is on the uphill face of Ship's Prow Boulder, just right of the route Ships Prow.

content.description:
Sit start as for Bang Boom (V2) then traverse left on under-clings, using tricky footwork. Once on double under-clings make a long move to a tricky dynamic top out.  

  Being short is a distinct disadvantage... 

  If this has been done before or have any different info let me know, I will be glad to fix it...
content.location: Start as for Bang Boom (V2) and traverse left through under-clings than do a big move to a jug, to a tough top out.

content.description: On the ships prow boulder, it is five fet left of the sharp arete by the tree. Sit start on the undercling and small crimp to the right bump left up to a "side" pull and right into smaller crimp, move feet up and make big move to slopper/crimp do some fancy moves to the top.
content.location: Ships prow boulder, sit start where waterruns from under the boulder when it is wet and workork up face. This problem faces the road.

content.description:
On the uphill side of the Ships Prow boulder, on the obvious weakness in the middle of the face. Top out is huge. Really easy moves from a stand start will gain the top. 

  The route is a little dirty, but still fun.
content.location: On the Ship's Prow boulder in the middle of the uphill face.

content.description: This boulder is a small boulder but holds a few great routes my suggestion is Bang Boom (V2). This boulder isnt very tall so it is a good place for new climbs and has routes from V0- to V2 but has some potential for other routes.
